sentence: I use a sword to argue with people. they usually get my point.
explanation: A point is a sharp end of an object or a specific location/point in a discussion or argument.
first_new_sentence: The pencil has a sharp point that can easily write on paper.
second_new_sentence: During the debate, I presented my point clearly to make my argument strong.

sentence: Why do onions have poor self-image? because people cry when they get onions naked.
explanation: Naked means without clothing or protection, and in cooking, it can refer to being unpeeled.
first_new_sentence: The model appeared on stage completely naked for the fashion show.
second_new_sentence: The chef served the dish with naked vegetables, unadorned and fresh.

sentence: Knock knock joke knock knock whos there broken pencil broken pencil who never mind...its pointless!
explanation: Pointless refers to something that has no purpose and also refers to a pencil without a point.
first_new_sentence: The discussion we had yesterday felt completely pointless to me.
second_new_sentence: The pencil is so short it has become pointless and cannot be sharpened anymore.

sentence: These entries follow the requested format and provide the relevant serious sentences alongside the original joke context.
